title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.8.10-11 | 02-02-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya
Chaksharunmeelitam Jena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Velanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhigaura Bhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Chai Vanarottamam Deveem Saraswateem
Vyasam Tato Jaya Mudireet
In this session we will be discussing from the 10th verse
of the 8th chapter.
This is the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
From the previous session the prayer offered by Uttara continues to Lord Krishna.
This is the 10th verse Abhidhravati Maam Eesha Sharastata Yaso Vibho
Kamam Dahatum Maam Natha.
Maam Eesha Sharastata Yaso Vibho Kamam Dahatum Maam Natha.
Maam Eesha Sharastata Yaso Vibho Kamam Dahatum Maam Natha.
Garbho Nipat Pyatam.
So this is another part of the prayer offered by Uttara to Lord Krishna.
So the translation of this verse is
O my Lord, you are all powerful.
A fiery iron arrow is coming towards me fast.
My Lord, let it burn me.
personally if you so desire but please do not let it burn and about my embryo please do me this favor
my lord so uttara is praying for the protection of the child in her womb
because a fiery iron arrow is fast approaching her her embryo
and she is praying that let it burn me personally i don't mind but let it not burn the child in the
womb now sri la prabhupada explains in the purport very nicely this incident took place
after the death of abhimanyu the husband of uttara
abhimanyu as i mentioned in a
earlier session died in the battle of kurukshetra abhimanyu's widow uttara should have followed the
path of her husband but because she was pregnant and maharaj parikshit the great devotee of the
lord was lying in the embryo she was responsible for his protection she was pregnant when abhimanyu
died so she did not die along with the husband
she did not follow the sati procedure for a chaste wife when the husband dies
then the wife cannot bear the separation from the husband the fire of separation is
much more intense and intolerable than the fire of the burning funeral pyre of the husband
therefore a wife is not allowed to be separated from her husband because the husband is not allowed to be separated from her wife
a chaste wife who is without children she generally dies along with the
husband's funeral that's called sati and by such an action she elevates herself
which elevates her consciousness that is that is a that is a symbol of chastity
now here Uttara should have followed her husband but because she was pregnant she
did not do so and who was in the womb it was not an ordinary child it was Maharaj
Pariksit a great devotee of the Lord and
as a mother she is responsible for his protection the mother of a child has a
great responsibility in giving all protection to the child and therefore
Uttara was not ashamed to express this frankly before lord Krishna she very
frankly admitted that I want to protect my child kindly save this child
Uttara was the daughter of Maharaj
a great king. Her father was also a great king. The wife of a great hero Abhimanyu was a great
hero fought valiantly in the battle of Kurukshetra. She was his wife. A student of a great devotee
and later she was a mother of a good king also. Student of a great devotee when
Pandavas were incognito living incognito in Virata's kingdom. Uttara was the daughter of
King Virata. So she was Arjuna disguised himself as a dance teacher and Uttara became the student
of Arjuna. So therefore a student of a great devotee Arjuna is that great devotee. And later
she was a mother of a good king also. That is Parikshit Maharaj.
Arjuna became the emperor of the world and so later on she was the mother of the great king.
She was fortunate in every respect. So that is the position of Uttara that is being glorified here.
Now the next verse describes what is the response of Krishna.
The eleventh verse.
So, the meaning of this eleventh verse
Suta Goswami is speaking. Having patiently heard her words Lord Shri Krishna who's always very
devotees Bhaktavatsala could at once understand that Ashwatthama the son of
Dronacharya had thrown the Brahmastra to finish the last life in the Pandava family.
If you remember this Dronacharya son Ashwatthama had tried to throw a
Brahmastra to save his own life earlier when Arjuna was chasing him and Krishna
directed Arjuna to neutralize the Brahmastra so that it would not do any harm.
Now again he has thrown a Brahmastra to finish the last life of the in the Pandava family.
This only surviving descendant of the Pandavas. So in the purport Srila Prabhupada says
the Lord is impartial in every respect but still he is inclined towards the
Lord.
The Lord supports his devotees because there is a great necessity of this for
everyone's well-being. Devotees are meant for the well-being of everyone in the
world. Because devotees do the greatest welfare activity. There are many people
who are engaged in different kinds of welfare activity. But which welfare
activity is the best?
That which reinstates every living being in his or her original position as the
loving devotee of the Supreme Lord in his personal abode. We all belong to Krishna.
There is no reason for us to suffer in this material world other than our foolishness of
becoming forgetful of Krishna or being rebellious, envious of Krishna, trying to compete with
Krishna, trying to assume Krishna's position or trying to be independent of Krishna. So
many different reasons can be cited why living beings in this material world who don't belong
to this world, who belong to Krishna's personal abode, they are away from Krishna due to various
reasons and all foolish, all foolish reasons, all foolish reasons. So the Lord takes compassion
and he personally comes and he instructs, he speaks the Bhagavad Gita, he sends his
representatives and those representatives are being mentioned here. Because there is a great
necessity
of Krishna's pure devotees in this world for everyone's well-being. That's a great necessity.
The Pandava family was a family of devotees and therefore the Lord wanted them to rule
the world. See devotees rule the world then there is well-being for everyone. Because
the devotees see everyone as part and parcel of Krishna. They don't see them in terms of
their external body. Oh so and so is this particular resident or national or some particular
person belonging to particular state or community or caste or no that's not the way a devotee
sees other living beings. A devotee sees all living beings as part and parcel of Krishna.
This is what is told in the Bhagavad Gita. Krishna is described in the Bhagavad Gita as
surdasarvabhutana and the devotees are described as surdasarvadehina. Same meaning. Sarvadehina
means all living beings in different forms of bodies. Sarvabhutana means all devotees.
Sarvabhutana means all different living beings in different forms of bodies. Same meaning.
So the Lord is the best well-wisher of all living beings. Similarly his pure devotees
are also the best well-wishers of all living beings. So both the Lord and his pure devotees
are similarly the well-wishers.
That was the reason he vanquished the rule of the company of Duryodhana and established
the rule of Maharaja Yudhishtira. It's not a question of just competency in ruling. Duryodhana
was competent to rule. We can't say he was incompetent. But Duryodhana was lacking that
devotion. Therefore Duryodhana was typically having different kinds of feelings in his
heart for different categories of people. So and so is my enemy. So and so is my friend.
So and so is my well-wisher. Somebody else is my competitor. All kinds of this enviousness.
A mentality of differentiation based on externals without looking into the core of the heart
that every living being belongs to Krishna. A non-devotee himself doesn't know that he belongs
to Krishna. So how will he understand others connection with Krishna. He will never understand
by himself if he continues to be in material existence. So therefore to bring about the
welfare of all the citizens.
All the people of this world. Krishna vanquished the rule of the company of Duryodhana and
established the rule of Maharaja Yudhishtira. He also wanted to protect Maharaja Pariksit
who was lying in the embryo for the same reason. The successor to Yudhishtira is Pariksit Maharaj.
The only surviving descendant in the entire Pandava era.
He did not like the idea that the world should be without the Pandavas, the ideal family
of devotees.
Apandavam idam kartum. Apandavam.
This Ashwathama wanted to finish off the last life in the Pandava family. So that the world
will be without any descendants of the Pandavas.
But Krishna did not like that. Because he wanted pure devotees to rule the world and
continue to successively rule. Their descendants who are also pure devotees should successfully
rule the world. That's what Krishna wants. And even preaching Krishna consciousness is
the only way to do that.
Everyone, especially the leaders, become Krishna conscious. That will do good to the entire
world. The leaders will set a good example for the common people and everyone can actually
become happy in Krishna consciousness. That's why this mission of preaching Krishna consciousness.
I'll stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
